remarks:
Equality has existential uniqueness.  Special case of ~ eueq1 proved using only predicate calculus.  The proof needs ` y = z ` be free of ` x ` .  This is ensured by having ` x ` and ` y ` be distinct. Alternatevly, a distinctor ` A. x x = y ` could have been used instead. (Contributed by Stefan Allan, 4-Dec-2008.)  (Proof shortened by Wolf Lammen, 8-Sep-2019.) 

---

 Equality has existential uniqueness.  (Contributed by Stefan Allan, 4-Dec-2008.)
statement:
euequ1 $p |- E! x x = y $.
$d x y $.
